result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon M Rapp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges to apply for work and treatment.

miscConds.notes: Complete an AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.

Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 3:00 p.m. on 10/25/2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.
Pay fine in the amount of $250.00 plus all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Any cash bond on deposit to be applied.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon M Rapp

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon M Rapp in court.  Attorney Michael J Steinle in court for Brandon M Rapp.  Attorney Kent Lovern in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim present via zoom. Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. State orally amends criminal complaint to reflect corrected Victim's initials. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered Defendant to serve 2 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 1 DAY time served. Huber privileges to apply for work and treatment.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 9 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
*-Complete 25 hours of community service.
*-Complete an anger management course.
*-NO CONTACT with A.B.

*-Complete an AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
*-Pay fine in the amount of $250 plus  ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 3:00pm on 10/25/2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.
*-Any cash bond on deposit to be applied. 

*APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights

Addendum to Plea Questionnaire

Jury Instructions 1900

Adjustment Number: 22A 094768,
Payable Number: 1036588,
Receipt Number: 22RP039744,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Brandon M Rapp appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Kent Lovern appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Michael Steinle appeared as a friend of the Court by video.
Case in court for pretrial conference. 
Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests additional time to review. Defense requests resolution date.  Case adjourned to Branch 30.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 09-16-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Brandon M Rapp in court.  Attorney Michael J Steinle in court for Brandon M Rapp.  Prosecuting attorney Catelin Ringersma in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 9/14/22 @ 1:30p
